body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`): 1.5.3

```
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.3", GitCommit:"029c3a408176b55c30846f0faedf56aae5992e9b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-02-22T10:12:27Z", GoVersion:"go1.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.3", GitCommit:"029c3a408176b55c30846f0faedf56aae5992e9b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"1970-01-01T00:00:00Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: minikube 0.17.1

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):

1. View config

```bash
$ kubectl config view
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority: /Users/everett/.minikube/ca.crt
    server: https://192.168.99.100:8443
  name: minikube
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: minikube
    user: minikube
  name: minikube
current-context: minikube
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: minikube
  user:
    client-certificate: /Users/everett/.minikube/apiserver.crt
    client-key: /Users/everett/.minikube/apiserver.key
```

Note that there's only one context.

2. Unset the property of a non-existent context

```bash
$ kubectl config unset contexts.foo.namespace
Property "contexts.foo.namespace" unset.
```

3. View config

```bash
$ kubectl config view
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority: /Users/everett/.minikube/ca.crt
    server: https://192.168.99.100:8443
  name: minikube
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: ""
    user: ""
  name: foo
- context:
    cluster: minikube
    user: minikube
  name: minikube
current-context: minikube
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: minikube
  user:
    client-certificate: /Users/everett/.minikube/apiserver.crt
    client-key: /Users/everett/.minikube/apiserver.key
```

Note that a context named foo was created just because I tried to unset a property.

**What you expected to happen**:

`kubectl config unset contexts.foo.namespace` should give an informative message saying that context `foo` doesn't exist.

**Anything else we need to know**:

This is probably low-hanging fruit.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: Unsetting the property of a non-existent context creates that context
